About

Carlos Salgado

Electrical and computer engineer (M.E.Sc. ‘2018) and mechatronics engineer (B.Eng. ‘2011) with over 6 years of professional experience in manufacturing and repair environments. I have broad interests ranging from robotics, mechatronics, embedded devices, software and signal processing. I am currently learning about applied AI and Deep Learning, feel free to check out my GitHub for more information.

London, ON, Canada

Credentials

Master's Degree in Electrical and Computer Engineering

Research-based program with a project on 3D medical image processing and courses on advanced statistics and advanced image analysis.

Professional Certificate on Applied AI by IBM

6-course specialization with hands-on labs on cloud computing APIs, machine learning, natural language processing, Python Pandas and computer vision with OpenCV.

Certificate on Data Science by LinkedIn

8-course learning path covering statistics, data governance, big data, data mining, Excel 2016, data analysis and visualization using Python, R and BigML.

Text Mining with Python

Converted local job site HTML to comma-separated values (*.csv) dataset then pre-processed using Pandas and regular expressions to finally mine text using the natural language toolkit and pillow to output word-clouds and histograms.

  • Project url:
  • Technology used: Python, Jupyter Notebooks, NLP, Pandas, RegEx, Pillow
  • Date: October 2019
  • Category: Data Science

Online Shop-Deployed Bot

Deployed a recommender chat bot that suggests shopping items to users based on their input.

  • Project url:
  • Technology used: NLP, Machine Learning, IBM Watson Assistant, API, WordPress, Integration, Artificial Intelligence
  • Date: October 2019
  • Category: Machine Learning

Student Advisor Bot

Used IBM APIs to build a Natural Language Processing chat bot to recommend Coursera courses based on input received as well as to solve issues with the Coursera website.

  • Project url:
  • Technology used: NLP, Machine Learning, IBM Watson Assistant, API, JSON, Queries, Artificial Intelligence
  • Date: October 2019
  • Category: Machine Learning

DICOM Bone Volume Renderer

Written in C++, uses the Visualization Toolkit (VTK) to read a Computed Tomography DICOM (*.dcm) image file and render its bone data. Only intensities above 350 Hounsfield Units (HU) are rendered to allow the viewing of air cells in the temporal bones.

  • Project url:
  • Technology used: C++, CMake, VTK, OpenGL, Visual Studio 2019, GitHub, Bash
  • Date: July 2019
  • Category: Software Development

Customized PC Workstation

Built and customized 3.2 Ghz 8-core processor, 8 GB GPU PC, 16 GB DDR4 RAM and 512 GB nVME HDD PC. Optimizing all CPU cores to 4.0Ghz (VCore = 1.28 V) and GPU speed to 1610 Ghz. See link for full part list and details.

  • Project url:
  • Technology used: Hardware, Parts Selection, Screwdriver, Cable management, Electrical Troubleshooting
  • Date: March 2019
  • Category: Hardware

Development of image-based surgical planning software for bone-conduction implants

Temporal bone computed tomography (CT) images were segmented and processed and custom Matlab code was written to generate and test bone thickness colormaps from cortical bone to the air-cell and from the cortical bone to the dura mater (the layer of membrane covering the brain). See project link for full thesis file.

  • Project url:
  • Technology used: MATLAB, 3D Slicer, 3D Systems Geomagic, IBM SPSS, GraphPad Prism
  • Date: August 2018
  • Category: Research

C POSIX and RTLinux HVAC simulation

System Integration of PIC microcontroller, temperature sensor, RTOS terminal and power switching printed circuit board

  • Project url:
  • Technology used: RT-PReempt Linux Kernel, C, POSIX, Autodesk EAGLE, MPLAB IDE, PICC C, RS232
  • Date: August 2011
  • Category: Mechatronics

Robotic Kinematics

RoRR robotic manipulator analysis considering work space, positions and forward and inverse kinematics using movement equations

  • Project url:
  • Technology used: Lego NXT
  • Date: September 2010
  • Category: Robotics

LabVIEW DAQ Live Temperature Monitoring

Thermistor sensor sent temperature signal in Volts into DAQ (Data Acquisition) hardware interfacing with LabVIEW software to characterize the signal using known resistance-temperature equations and displaying temperature measurements in degrees Celsius.

  • Project url:
  • Technology used: LabVIEW, NI DAQ, Thermistor sensor
  • Date: August 2010
  • Category: Mechatronics
